intro: Machilus sikkimensis, commonly known as the Sikkim Machilus, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to the Himalayan region. It belongs to the Lauraceae family and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at elevations ranging from 1,500 to 3,000 meters. Its fruits are drupes that mature to a dark purple color, containing a single seed. The leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a distinct aromatic scent when crushed.
